original: Adell, Johannes Albin Gunnar, överläkare, Jönköping, f. 11/9/05 i Vä, Krist. 1., av folksk :lär. o. kantorn Johannes A. o. Anna Olsson. G. 32 m. fil. kand. Gun Larsson. Barn: Johan f. 38, Margareta 40, Gunnar 45. — Stud:ex. i Kristianstad 24, med. kand. i Lund 27 o. med. lic. där 32. Vik. und.iäk. v. Långbro sjukh. 32, tf. und:-läk. där 32-34, assist :läk. v. Äsö sjukh. 34, åter v. Långbro sjukh. s. tf. und:-läk. 34-35, und :läk. v. Beckomberga sjukh. 35-36, andre läk. v. S :t Sigfrids sjukh. 36, förste läk. v. Ryhovs sjukh. i Jönköp. 43, ord. överläk. v. rätts-psykiatr. avd. där sed. 46, fängiläk. i Växjö o. Jönköp. 37-45. På Kgl. Maj:ts uppdr. utf. psykiatr. und:sökn. av tvångsarb. å Landskrona o. Svartsjö tvångsarb :anst. 38. Skr.: upps. i psykiatri.
translated: Adell, Johannes Albin Gunnar, chief physician, Jönköping, born on September 11th, 1905 in Vä, Kristianstad county to primary school teacher and cantor Johannes A. and Anna Olsson. Married in 1932 to Gun Larsson with whom he had three children: Johan (born 1938), Margareta (born 1940), and Gunnar (born 1945). He passed his final secondary school examination in Kristianstad in 1924, obtained his Bachelor of Medicine degree in Lund in 1927 and his medical license there in 1932. He served as a temporary military doctor at Långbro Hospital in 1932, acting as a substitute doctor there from 1932-1934, as an assistant physician at Äsö Hospital in 1934, and returned to Långbro Hospital as a temporary substitute doctor from 1934-1935, as well as a non-permanent physician at Beckomberga Hospital in 1935-1936, a second physician at St. Sigfrid's Hospital in 1936, first physician at Ryhov Hospital in Jönköping in 1943, and an ordinary chief physician in the forensic psychiatry department there since 1946. He was also a prison doctor in Växjö and Jönköping from 1937-1945. On the order of the Royal Majesty, he conducted psychiatric investigations of forced labor at Landskrona and Svartsjö forced labor camps in 1938. He has written papers in psychiatry.

additionalProperty.name: Royal Majesty Order
additionalProperty.value: Conducted psychiatric investigations of forced labor at Landskrona and Svartsjö forced labor camps in 1938.
